intro: Pseudobombax ellipticum var. tenuiflorum, commonly known as the slender-flowered elliptic ceiba, is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, winged seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland rainforests. Its unique floral structure and ornamental value make it a notable species in botanical gardens and ecological studies.
